1.text: Wherefore from the Mighty One Times have not been hidden, And those knowing Him have not seen His days.

2.text: The borders they reach, A drove they have taken violently away, Yea, they do evil.

3.text: The ass of the fatherless they lead away, They take in pledge the ox of the widow,

4.text: They turn aside the needy from the way, Together have hid the poor of the earth.

5.text: Lo, wild asses in a wilderness, They have gone out about their work, Seeking early for prey, A mixture for himself—food for young ones.

6.text: In a field his provender they reap, And the vineyard of the wicked they glean.

7.text: The naked they cause to lodge Without clothing. And there is no covering in the cold.

8.text: From the inundation of hills they are wet, And without a refuge—have embraced a rock.

9.text: They take violently away From the breast the orphan, And on the poor they lay a pledge.

10.text: Naked, they have gone without clothing, And hungry—have taken away a sheaf.

11.text: Between their walls they make oil, Wine-presses they have trodden, and thirst.

12.text: Because of enmity men do groan, And the soul of pierced ones doth cry, And God doth not give praise.

13.text: They have been among rebellious ones of light, They have not discerned His ways, Nor abode in His paths.

14.text: At the light doth the murderer rise, He doth slay the poor and needy, And in the night he is as a thief.

15.text: And the eye of an adulterer Hath observed the twilight, Saying, ‘No eye doth behold me.’ And he putteth the face in secret.

16.text: He hath dug in the darkness—houses; By day they shut themselves up, They have not known light.

17.text: When together, morning is to them death shade, When he discerneth the terrors of death shade.

18.text: Light he is on the face of the waters, Vilified is their portion in the earth, He turneth not the way of vineyards.

19.text: Drought—also heat—consume snow-waters, Sheol those who have sinned.

20.text: Forget him doth the womb, Sweeten on him doth the worm, No more is he remembered, And broken as a tree is wickedness.

21.text: Treating evil the barren who beareth not, And to the widow he doth no good,

22.text: And hath drawn the mighty by his power, He riseth, and none believeth in life.

23.text: He giveth to him confidence, and he is supported, And his eyes are on their ways.

24.text: High they were for a little, and they are not, And they have been brought low. As all others they are shut up, And as the head of an ear of corn cut off.

25.text: And if not now, who doth prove me a liar, And doth make of nothing my word?
